ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable minimum will be updated to 0x2386f26fc10000.
- the state variable step will be updated to 4.

For the transferOwnership function, it has 2 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, address.
- When the first argument is not 0, and for owner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to the first argument.
  - the state variable ownerwallet will be updated to the second argument.

For the payable fallback function.
- When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than minimum:
  - When the checkinvestments of caller is not greater than 0:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the checkinvestments of caller).
  - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
  - When (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100) is 0:
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
    - When the checkinvestments of caller is greater than 0, and 0 is smaller than the balance of caller:
      - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
      - When (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
        - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is 0:
          - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
      - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to ownerwallet.
  - When (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100) is not 0:
    - it transfers (5*(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100)) to ownerwallet.
    - When the checkinvestments of caller is greater than 0, and 0 is smaller than the balance of caller:
      - it transfers (5*(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100)) to ownerwallet.
      - When (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
        - it transfers (5*(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100)) to ownerwallet.
        - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is 0:
          - it transfers (5*(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100)) to ownerwallet.
      - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
        - it transfers (5*(the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)/100)) to ownerwallet.
  - When the checkinvestments of caller is greater than 0, and 0 is smaller than the balance of caller:
    - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the checkinvestments of caller).
    - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
    - When (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
      - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller). Afterthat, 
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
      - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
      - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the checkinvestments of caller).
      - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
      - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is 0:
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller). Afterthat, 
          - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
        - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
        - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the checkinvestments of caller).
        - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.
    - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0:
      - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller). Afterthat, 
        - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to 0.
      - it transfers ether valued (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
      - the checkinvestments of caller will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the checkinvestments of caller).
      - the balance of caller will be updated to current time.

For the bounty function.
- When the checkreferral of caller is not smaller than minimum, and the checkreferral of caller is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
  - it transfers ether valued the checkreferral of caller to caller. Afterthat, 
    - the checkreferral of caller will be updated to 0.

For the updateReferral function, it has 2 arguments and the type of each argument is as follows: address, uint256.
- For bountymanager:
  - the checkreferral of the first argument will be updated to (the second argument+the checkreferral of the first argument).

For the withdraw function.
- When 0 is smaller than the balance of caller:
  - When (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0, and (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract:
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller).
    - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
    - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is 0:
      - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((0-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller).
      - it transfers ether valued (0-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
  - When the checkinvestments of the address is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is smaller than the balance of the address of this contract, and ((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100) is not 0, and (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) is greater than 0:
    - the checkwithdrawals of caller will be updated to ((((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address)+the checkwithdrawals of caller).
    - it transfers ether valued (((((current time-the balance of the address)/60)*((step*the checkinvestments of the address)/100))/1440)-the checkwithdrawals of the address) to caller.
